channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Just one woman has ever founded and led a Fortune 500 company. Here’s her story
item.description: Marion Sandler was the cofounder and co-CEO of mortgage lender Golden West Financial.

item.title: GoFundMe for teen who jumped in to work at Burger King on his graduation night tops $200,000
item.description: Mykale Baker volunteered to help overwhelmed coworkers.

item.title: Apple, X, and Airbnb among growing number of Big Tech firms exploring crypto adoption
item.description: Fortune 500 tech firms are having early conversations with crypto companies about stablecoin integration.

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv in Apparent Retaliation for Ukrainian Drone Assault
item.description: The attack on Friday, which killed at least four people nationwide, came two days after Russia vowed retaliation for an audacious drone assault on its...

item.title: Ex-Girlfriend Says Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Ignored Requests for Escorts to Wear Condoms
item.description: Testifying under a pseudonym, “Jane,” the woman has described “hotel nights” involving drugs and sex with escorts that she told Sean Combs she did not...

item.title: Arise, Sir David Beckham: The Soccer Star Will Be Knighted
item.description: The British news media reported that the on-field golden boy and international celebrity will receive the honor from King Charles III.

item.title: Hiring is slowing but still solid, with 139,000 jobs added last month
item.description: The full effects of massive tariffs likely have not been felt yet, but the job market has clearly slowed.

item.title: ‘Get the popcorn out’: Dan Ives warns Tesla shareholders Musk-Trump war may have only just begun
item.description: As Musk calls for his erstwhile ally to be stripped of his office and replaced, Wedbush's Tesla perma-bull fears for the worst but hopes for the best.

item.title: A Professor Was Fired for Her Politics. Is That the Future of Academia?
item.description: Maura Finkelstein is one of many scholars discovering that the traditional protections of academic freedom are no longer holding.

item.title: 2025 Tony Awards Predictions: Best New Musical, Best Leading Actress and More
item.description: Expect wins for the musicals “Maybe Happy Ending” and “Sunset Boulevard,” but the races for best play and leading actress in a musical are too close t...

item.title: Xi to Trump: Rein in the Hawks Trying to Derail the Tariff Truce
item.description: China sought to depict a call between Xi Jinping and President Trump as an appeal from one strongman leader to another to run a tight ship and stay on...

item.title: Interpol Arrests 20 Over Network That Distributed Child Sex Abuse Material
item.description: The international sweep included arrests in 12 countries across Europe and the Americas. The agency said there were also dozens of other suspects.

item.title: Who Is Yasser Abu Shabab, the Leader of the Israeli-Backed Militia in Gaza?
item.description: Yasser Abu Shabab, a Bedouin man in his 30s, holds sway in eastern Rafah, an area close to a key border crossing between Israel and Gaza.

item.description: The attack on Friday, which killed at least four people nationwide, came two days after Russia vowed retaliation for an audacious drone assault on its...

item.title: Arise, Sir David Beckham: The Soccer Star Will Be Knighted
item.description: The British news media reported that the on-field golden boy and international celebrity will receive the honor from King Charles III.
